background.text: I am a Computer Science fresh graduate with a passion for web/software development and UI/UX design.
background.bulletOne: Currently seeking opportunities in a career-oriented environment that fosters both personal growth and professional development.
background.bulletTwo: Eager to contribute to a forward-thinking company, helping to achieve its goals and vision, and playing a part in its mission.

details: Authored a UI/UX design guideline for consistent project design.

education.secondary: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

training.name: WordPress, Marketing, Copywriting, and Facebook Ads Training

Projects.name: Portfolio
Projects.description: This portfolio website, which you're currently browsing, is a project in itself. It serves as a platform to display my projects, provide an overview of my credentials, and share contact details, as well as a practice for React and Vite.

Projects.name: Tic-Tac-Toe
Projects.description: A Tic Tac Toe game, made for practicing JS factory functions and the module pattern.

Projects.name: Sunny-Side-Up
Projects.description: A weather forecast site, built with WeatherAPI, allows users to search for a location and view its current weather and future forecast. This project is designed for practicing asynchronous code and working with APIs.

Projects.name: PKMN RPS
Projects.description: My take on the classic beginner's project, the Rock-Paper-Scissors game. In my version, the game is played with fire, water, and grass instead of rock, paper, and scissors. It served as a practical exercise for integrating JavaScript with HTML and CSS.

Projects.name: Etch-A-Sketch
Projects.description: A web-based sketchpad with adjustable grid size and line opacity. It allows color selection, opacity changes, erasing, clearing tiles, and downloading of work. It was created to practice DOM manipulation.

Projects.name: The Dino Spyder
Projects.description: A basic webpage dedicated to the Ferrari Dino, designed as a way to practice using the CSS clip-path.

Projects.name: My Bookshelf
Projects.description: A small library web app where users can input a book and its details and whether the user has already read it or not. Created for practicing JS objects and constructors.

Projects.name: Dashboard
Projects.description: A simple one page dashboard created for practicing CSS grid.

Projects.name: Sign-up form
Projects.description: A sign-up form for an imaginary service, created as a practice exercise for intermediate HTML and CSS concepts, as well as the fundamentals of Forms, including client/HTML validation.

Projects.name: Calculator
Projects.description: An on-screen calculator, a classic beginnerâ€™s project, that allows users to input mathematical expressions and carry out basic arithmetic operations, including modulo. An added feature of this calculator is its ability to keep a history of calculations made.

Projects.name: Chick'n Dip
Projects.description: A restaurant website for a made-up business specializing in fried chicken and dipping sauce. Designed to practice DOM manipulation and webpack fundamentals.

Projects.name: Purrfect Match
Projects.description: A simple landing page for a made-up pet adoption service. Created for the purpose of practicing CSS basics, Flexbox, and the fundamentals of Git & Github.

Projects.name: Auto-Captioning System
Projects.description: A Chrome extension-based auto-captioning system for the Filipino language that utilizes CNN-RNN with CTC. It displays the transcription for recognized Filipino words when turned on, and can be used across various websites.

Projects.name: Zozor Travel Diaries
Projects.description: A web development exercise where we recreated the Zozor Travel Diaries website and added a few extra features.

Projects.name: Da'Best Coffee
Projects.description: A web development exercise where we created a website for our own made up brand that specifically must include the necessary pages: home, menu, music, and jobs.

Projects.name: Philippine News Agency
Projects.description: Our school group's design take on the Philippine News Agency website. It comprises of about 20 pages of designs.

Projects.name: Library System
Projects.description: A library system for San Jose National High School that helps with library tasks. It lets the users to borrow, return, and look for books by title or author, and also check if a book is available. Additionally, users can create an account as either an admin or a student. Admin users can manage the book inventory.
